history.title: History
history.subtitle: The story behind Back to Black
history.paragraph1: I've always been a big fan of dark themes â€” Ayu Dark, Dracula, Darcula, Night Owl, and many others. But all of them had one thing that always made me go back to my own customizations: they looked too bright ðŸ˜…. They're not "light" themes, of course, but none of them truly delivered a real #000 with a comfortable contrast for the eyes.
history.paragraph2: The few full-black themes I found had the opposite problem: overly harsh contrast, poor color customization, and any color applied over pure black ended up looking way too intense.
history.paragraph3: So I finally decided to do something about it and thought:
history.quote: "Many people must feel the same way. I'll take my internal theme tweaks, improve them, and share them online for anyone who wants to download."
history.paragraph4: And that's how Back to Black was born. Every time I tried other dark themes, I always ended up going back to black â€” literally, back to black.
history.paragraph5: I later discovered there's a song by Amy Winehouse with the same name ðŸ˜…. I had no idea when I created the theme and published it on VS Code. I just looked it up online to see if the name showed up anywhere â€” and that's when I found out. Great song, by the way!
